data.name: Election Count
data.description:
Polling has just closed and the votes are in. Your task is to determine: 

1. Who is the next president 
2. Which candidates will form the next cabinet
3. Which party will have the majority

The input is an array of objects in the following formats and passed into your function:

```
[
  {
    name: 'bob',
    votes: 50,
    party: 'Democrats'
  }
]
```
1. The next president is the candidate with the highest votes
2. The cabinet is formed by the candidates with the 4 highest votes excluding the president and the input will always contain more than 5 candidates
3. The party with the majority is the one with the most candidates in the cabinet including the president

The input will never be empty.

Candidate names will be unique.

All candidates will have a unique number of votes.

There are only two parties in the election

Examples:

INPUT:

```
[
    {
        "name": "Bob",
        "votes": 50,
        "party": "Democrats"
    },
    {
        "name": "Alice",
        "votes": 10,
        "party": "Republicans"
    },
    {
        "name": "Chad",
        "votes": 20,
        "party": "Democrats"
    },
    {
        "name": "Ed",
        "votes": 60,
        "party": "Republicans"
    },
    {
        "name": "James",
        "votes": 35,
        "party": "Democrats"
    },
    {
        "name": "Jamal",
        "votes": 40,
        "party": "Republicans"
    }
]
```
OUTPUT:

```
'The next president is Ed and the cabinet will be formed by Bob, Jamal, James and Chad with a majority held by the Democrats'
```

The cabinet members are outputted in descending order in the string according to votes collected.
